oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quilts; Beds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bedroom in the home of Susie Gentry in Franklin, Tennessee. A canopy bed can be seen. A silk quilt is on the bed.

Susie Gentry (1860-1944) was a genealogist, artist, composer, historian, and regent of the Old Glory Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution in Williamson County. She was the only child of Watson Meredith and Martha A. (Jones) Gentry. She is buried at Mt. Hope Cemetery in Franklin, Tennessee.
